metadata.title: Lecture 54: Introduction to Stacks [Theory + Implementation] || C++ Placement Course
metadata.description:
In this Video, we are going to learn about Stack Data Structure and its Implementation.

There is a lot to learn, Keep in mind “ Mnn bhot karega k chor yrr apne se nahi hoga ya maza nahi aara, Just ask 1 question “ Why I started ? “

For 20% Discount ] Visit Coding Ninjas:  https://bit.ly/3cfdKTe 

Discord Server Link:  https://discord.gg/feSQvVXMrd 

Course Flow: https://whimsical.com/dsa-4-placement-by-love-babbar-C7JX2fJ8hprv9ivEHkArjD@2Ux7TurymNF9zkFahVLk 

Slides Link: https://drive.google.

transcript.text: Hello ji ,how are you all? this is Love babbar
And welcome to the channel code help , we have reached our lecture no-54
With one more new topic , we have completed linked list properly in our last 10 videos , and also I have given you H/W
We are going to talk about stack , what is stack?
Lets understand this , all of you have gone to weddings
There are many plates like this
middle class weddings are like this , there are many plates , after taking plate you move forward
There are some vessels from where you take your food
The main point is here , 1st this plate has been placed
then this , then this , in the following manner but when you take
1st you will take this one then this , in the following manner
i want to say that here we are talking about a specific order  LIFO-Last in first out
Which is inserted in last , will come out 1st
In short stack -> data structure , Which is inserted in last , will come out 1st
If I have to give you the example , when we use to study about function call stack in recursion
This is not new for you
This is your stack
You filled something in it
here 1st I inserted 1 , then 2 , then 3
then 4 , so in this way I inserted in it , we call it push() operation
So 1st I pushed 1 , then 2 ,3 ,4
in same way if I want to remove , we call it pop(0 operation
The one which is inserted at last will come out 1st
4 , it is removed
When you popped , 3 comes out , again 2 will be popped out
Then 1 , in short how did you inserted ?
1 ,2 ,3 ,4 and when you pop you do like 4 ,3 ,2 ,1 , that's why I call it LIFO order
The one which is inserted at last will come out 1st , we learned about push() operation and also about pop() , we will learn more things , 1st lets give shout out to our sponsor
Coding Ninjas is one of the largest coding education platform , where you can take many courses
If you are interested in paid courses , if you want to do development ,machine learning , android ,web development , system design
OS , DBMS .DSA in Java , Python
Then you can take those paid courses from here , the best thing about CN is that , here you get one on one doubt solving support
If you have any doubt , then it will be resolved in 1-2 hours , courses are very well structured
If you work hard , then you will definitely get the result , educators have already cracked big companies
No need to worry . It is available in both Hindi and English
While solving question you will get hint videos , if you want to buy any paid course
The link is given in description , from there you will get the maximum discount , thankyou
If we talk about stack , it is data structure which follows LIFO order
Whatever comes last in stack will comes out 1st , as we have taken plate example , these are some plates
1st I have placed this plate then this , in following manner , when I will take , 1st I will take this one
Then this , in this way
If I talk about the operations , I have discussed push() operation , how we insert
then I discussed pop() operation , how we remove
There is one more operation peek() , lets say my stack state is of this type , there are 3 elements
This is the stack and I am looking from top . Then I will see 9 , peek means I will get the top element
I have one more function isEmpty() , I can go to this documentation cppreference.com . Here I got the definitions
I got the parameters , some functions , how can I access things
If I want to push then this is push() , this is pop() , if I have to check empty ,then I can check it from empty function
Lets say i created a stack , if I talk about STL
How a stack is created , it is very easy
Create the stack , then tell me the type , there will be int type data
stack<int> s, so in this way I created a stack
Now i want to push s.push(2) , in same way I want to do pop ,s.pop()
In this way if I want to see top element  ,s.top() , it will return me top element
If I want to see if it is empty or not
s.empty() , it will return me true or false
If i want to see size , there is also size function, there are many things available , you can read this
But here you understand that we can push() ,pop() , see the top element , or check is it empty or not
Lets see this by using STL , things will become clear to you
Create a stack of int type , include it 1st
Will it work now ? it ran
This is creation of stack
Now I want to push something
s.push(2) , now I want to pop something , lets say here I pushed 3
Then s.pop() , in short lets understand what would have happened here
From line no-9 you created a stack
Line no- 12 said to insert 2 , then line no-13 to insert 3then line no- 16  to pop the top element
3 will be removed , now your stack has become like this , there is only 2
Now i want to see the top element
If I run it then ans will be 2
I ran it, top element is 2
Now if I ask is it empty or not? then it will return false , let me print it
if (s.empty())  ,cout<< " Stack is empty"
else , cout<<" stack is not empty"
Lets run it , 2 is already present
So it should give stack is not empty , it gave stack is not empty
In short if we talk about STL , now you know to create stack , you know push() ,pop() ,top() , and you have also learned to check empty
There are more things , I have shown you , go through this
Lets read the definition , same thing , there is nothing additional
You will read this page
till now we have understood what is stack? if I have to tell you one more time
Stack is a data structure is follows LIFO order
In this element are coming like this
You pushed 1 then 2 , then 3 and 4
Now lets pop , when I popped 1st , 1st 4 will come out , then 3 , then 2, then 1
So here last in first out , 4 was inserted at last but comes out 1st
In this way we saw in code also , how we create stack and how to handle it
cout<< " size of stack is " << s.size ()<< endl
Ran it , stack size is 1, because there is only 2 , only one element
Comment out this , lets move to our next task
Now if someone ask what is stack? it is easy to tell
Or if says to use stack in code , it is also easy
You can code using STL , let say someone says implement stack
It is normal , it is asked . you can get stuck in it
Basically create a class stack
And implement push() ,pop() , peek() , empty() in this
I don't want to use STL , I want to create by on class
Lets create a class , which will perform all the functions
class stack , there will be some data members
there will be some functions
Did you get this? I want to create it in this way
To implement stack I have two ways
1. By using array , 2. by using linked list
One I will show you and  2nd will be in H/W , until you code by yourself you will not learn it
Lets understand stack implementation using array
This is an array , there are some spaces , these are the indexing
You named it arr , we will do 1st push()
I need the index where I want to push or where space is available
In short , there is top ->index where I can push
In starting it will be -1
If we are inserting 1st element , I will put it here , then here , in the following manner
When it gets full , the it will be stack over flow , now I can't put more element
I need a top by which we will track that is there any space is available or not
If there is then I will insert element
In properties we need top , and we also need this array
int * arr  , we will decide the size in constructor , we have seen it in class lecture
Now what will be the size ?  I should have the information that I have reached the size
For that I need the size of array
In short I need these 3 things if I want to implement stack using array
Lets talk about push() operation
lets say this is my array , in starting top=-1
Then you pushed 22 , 1st it will check is there any space
If there is space then you inserted it
There can be to things true /false , if space is not available then stack is already filled . Here you can push
If it is available then insert . How? 1st increment the top , now top=0
arr[ top] =22, in this way you inserted it
Lets talk about pop()
1st we will check is there any element present ?
There can be two case , T/F
If it is not present , then you can't perform pop , there will be stack underflow
this is your empty stack and you are trying to pop , then this condition will occur
If true , your top will be here , here is your 22 and top is pointing to it
I will decrement top by 1 , top=-1
How will we check element is present or not ? it is easy
If top>=0 , then there element is present
When top=-1 , in that case your stack is empty
So we saw push() , then pop() , now we want to check whether stack is empty or not
If top=-1 , it means stack is empty
4. top() , it gives me the top element without removing it
This is my array , there is 22 , and top is pointing to it
If I see it from top , I have to return arr[top]
Here we have to check whether top=-1 or not , if it is -1 then it will not work and it should be less then size also
While coding it we will get it , But here we have taken little clarity if I have to perform these 4 operations
Then I have  to think in which direction
1st I need the array , then top , then the size
1st of all I created the constructor , i will put size in it
this->size=size , we have written this here
We have already studied this
Then here created the array , in this way you have done it
Your constructor is initializing this size
And you initialized with -1
Now I have 4 operations , 1. void push( int element ) , then there is void pop()
Then there is int top() , int peek()
Then there is one more function bool isEmpty() , did you get it
Lets talk about push , 1st I have to check whether space is available or not
This is an array , in starting my top is -1 , it will push elements in the following manner
Then how I will know whether space is available or not
I have to find out whether there is any space or not
this is the size , in starting top=-1 , size-top>1, it means I have at least one space
if(size-top>1) , there is space , top++
arr[ top] =element , else , cout<<" Stack overflow" << endl
In pop() I have to check , at least there should be one element
if(top>=0) , in this case you can pop , else , you can't . Here you will decremented top
In esle , cout<<" Underflow"
If anyone says that he/she want to see top element , return arr[ top], here we have to put a condition
if( top>=0 && top<size ) , then you can return
else , cout<<" Stack is empty"<<endl
and retrurn -1 , in this case I thing there is no need of this
So in this way you peeked it
We have to check empty , if( top ==-1 ) it means stack is empty , return True
else , false
So in this way we completed the stack class
Lets clear it and run it
Create a stack we named it st (5)
Push 22 in the stack , then 43 ,44
Print the top of the stack , st.top()
Lets run it , is there any mistake?
Oo this method name is peek
If I show you , in line no-62 you inserted 22
Then 43 , then 44
If now anyone say to do peek , then my answer will be 44 , I printed it
Pop()
Now print it
in short 44 got removed , now there is 22 and 43
If I perform peek then it will print 43
Again I repeated the same thing
I popped 43 , now there is only 22 , now if I see from the top , 22
I repeated the process
in short I popped 22 , now my stack has become empty
Lets run it
Stack is empty and returned -1
if( st.isEmpty() 0 , Stack is empty
Stack is not empty
Lets run it . In short i know here I pushed 3 time , and I have already done 3 pops , so stack is empty
But for confirmation lets run it
Stack is empty . Assume it is of size=5 , and I tried to push 6 elements
Then what will happen in that case , run it
Stack overflow . In short 5 spaces are already filled , when it went to push 70
there is Stack overflow , and we can't put more elements
So in this way we have created a stack class
Now if someone says to implement stack , then it is easy for you , this is logic
If you want to push , check the empty space , then insert it
In pop() , check whether there is any element , then popped
If not , Then you will print stack is empty
peek() ,you want to see the top element , then you returned the top of the array , and it should be in valid range
Stack will be empty. If top=-1 then stack is empty
In short , if i have to tell the complexity of push() , it is O(1)
You are popping in O(1) , for peek() also it is O(1)
Empty also in O(1)
So you are performing all these in O(1)
In short someone asked you to implement stack , then you will say it is easy
In same way someone says to implement stack in LL , then you have to do it by yourself
We have studied linked list properly , it will be easy for you
To do the practical of the topics that we have learned , so we are going to do question
So that you can apply what you have learned
Implement two stacks in array
You have learned to implement stack in 1 array , now we have solve this one
To implement two stacks in array
So you have these four functions , push1()  push2() ,pop1() , pop2()
You have to complete them
So we will solve this
Here it is written medium
Lets solve this , how to solve it
Approach will be same , if we have to push , we will check whether there is any space
While popping we will check whether there is any element or not
But how will we do it in array ? we have understand it
Lets think of the variables that we need in class
I need an array , then only I can implement
int* arr, then I need top for both the stacks
int top1 , int top2
then I should know their size
in last approach we have seen , 1. array , 2. top , then the size
here we have discussed it
But I go here and talk about this question , there is need of size ? Lets think , yes
Why? It may be possible you are starting from here , and you are doing it but we don't know when will we stop
So I should know the size of the array , you created these for variables
lets think the logic , how will we solve it
You have two tops
but I have single array
So I will approach in such a way , for stack1 I will push from left to right
Its top1=-1 , like this
In short for stack1 my insertion will be from let to right
In stack2 top2 will be here , top2=size , I will insert like this
Insertion will be from right to left
Like this we will pop and insert
So here space is being utilized in an efficient manner
You inserted like this stack1 , there is nothing
Here we insert stack2 , and here stack 1 , so here you have efficiently utilised space
Both are working parallelly
One more approach can be that I give both 'n/2' space
But there is the possibility that this got filled fully , but there is some space left , so didn't used this logic
here we have used space in efficient manner by using these two top variables
in short , if I have to write this constructor , this->size=s
top1 =-1 , top2=s
Create the array
So I deed these 4 things
Now push1 , my stack1 will be here
Where top1=-1 , and stack2 will be here , top2= s, I will insert like this
Push in the 1st stack ,how?
At least there should be one space
if( top2 -top1 >1)
You will push like this  in stack1 and in this way in stack2
make sure that  top2-top1 > 1
This show that there is at least one space
So push in this space , we incremented top1
arr[top]=num ,else  ,cout<<" Stack overflow" <<endl
Is there anything more , no
Now we have to push in stack2 , here also the condition will be same
At least there should be one space , here I will decrement top2
And here you have inserted , and in esle overflow condition
Lets talk about pop() , here we use to check if there is any element then I will pop
So lets talk about pop1() , then I have to check whether there is any element present
if(top1>=0) , then pop
here you printed your answer , then you incremented top1
Assume here you have inserted 3 elements , and you have to pop this then you have to increment top1
else , return -1
if your stack is empty ,then return -1
Same in this way , we will do pop2(), here your top2<size ,in this case store the answer
Here what will you do? here we will increment top2 , and returned the answer
So we have coded in this way
And i don't think I need anymore statement , so I will remove it
Now if I run it , will it run ?
there is some error , put the ';'
Correct answer , now if I submit it
tell me in comment section will it come or not?
correct answer. So here we have written both the push functions and also the pop
Complexity wise it is working great. logic is also good , because we are using space efficiently
It can be the 1st way , that I would have given 'n/2' space to both
but it is not an efficient way
Space is not optimally utilized in this approach
I will take this array , from here my stack1 will move and from here stack two
Insert whatever mount of element you want to put , you can fill until the entire array is not filled
In short you can implement two stacks in a single array , I have taught you the approach
There is simple logic for push , for pop if there is any element then pop it
Write it once by yourself, if you didn't understand then repeat the video , it will become clear to you
That's it for this video , in next video we are going to do multiple questions of stack
